result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Allen Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Candace Blietz

Defendant Joseph Allen Green in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DEF pleads N/C to Counts 2 & 3.  DA presents sentence recommendation. DEF atty Hoffman concurs and states DEF is remorseful. Joint recommendation. Victim Candace Blitz agrees with sentence recommendation.  DA Poquette submitted Victim Impact Statment of Ms Blitz to court. Victim Jessica Harper did not respond to notification. DEF accepts responsibility for everything and feels remorse. 
Court finds DEF guilty on Counts 2 & 3. Count 1, dismissed and read-in. 
Count # 3 sentenced to 90 days county jail with Huber priviledges, credit for 1 day time served. Plus costs.
Count # 2 sentenced to 1 year probation, withheld, served consecutive to count # 3.   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations. Anger management assessment & follow-through with recommendations. Plus costs. $150.00 restitution to be paid Candace Blitz. No contact with Jessica Harper or Candace Blitz.
DEF atty Hoffman requests DEF to serve time in St Croix county with no cost to Sawyer county-granted.
DEF atty Hoffman requests time for client to find someone to watch child prior to serving sentence. Court sets time/date to report as 4 PM today.
Bond $900.00 applied to restitution first balance to court obligations any remaining balance to DOC per Judge's practice. CRB
